page.title: 18The Future of Chafford
page.content: At the top of Ramsey Hill is the sight of the Chafford school,which has been an area of{Social concern}over the last year. The school was housed in the grounds and buildings of the old{Michaelstow {Hall,}which was the most important house in the area many years ago.The site was taken over by the Council and used as a school for youths with behaviour problems.Now however it has been closed as the numbers of children sent here have fallen in recent years. Many local people are angry about what they see as a lack of concern by the County;for as yet there have been no indications(other than by rumour)of the future of this lovely site. Some local groups have tried to obtain permission to use some of the facilities,but have as yet had no success whatsoever.
